metadata.title: CVE-2021-21366 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
xmldom is a pure JavaScript W3C standard-based (XML DOM Level 2 Core)DOMParser and XMLSerializer module. xmldom versions 0.4.0 and older do notcorrectly preserve system identifiers, FPIs or namespaces when repeatedlyparsing and serializing maliciously crafted documents. This may lead tounexpected syntactic changes during XML processing in some downstreamapplications. This is fixed in version 0.5.0. As a workaround downstreamapplications can validate the input and reject the maliciously crafteddocuments.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21366` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-xmldom - 0.7.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-xmldom package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.5-1').
